title: Prepare GCP project and roles
content:
Role Location
Cloud administrator GCP Console

All GCP resources belong to a project. Before deploying the suite on GCP, you must either select an existing project or create a new one. For detailed information on a specific project including Project name, Project ID, and Project number, navigate to the GCP Console Home > Dashboard > Project info.

Roles and permissions on GCP

To deploy OMT and the suite on GCP, prepare the following accounts and resources with the required permissions. On GCP, permissions change with roles.

Compute Engine default service account

When you create a project, the Compute Engine default service account using email address [PROJECT_NUMBER]-compute@developer.gserviceaccount.com comes along with it automatically. By default, you can use this service account to access all instances under the project with the project Editor role.

To grant more required permissions to Compute Engine default service account, follow these steps:

  1. Log in to the Google Cloud Platform Console at https://console.cloud.google.com/.
  2. Navigate to IAM & Admin > IAM.
  3. Locate your Compute Engine default service account and click the pencil icon to edit its roles.
  4. Click ADD ANOTHER ROLE and add Kubernetes Engine Admin roles to this account.

A project comes with a Google Container Registry (GCR) accessible at gcr.io/<project_id>. The Compute Engine default service account of a project has access to its GCR automatically.

User account

To get ready for the installation and administration of the suite on GCP, you need to prepare your user account with the necessary roles. To check and add roles to your user account, follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to IAM & admin > IAM.
  2. Locate your user account and double-check it has Service Networking Admin and Editor roles.
  3. If the roles are missing, click the pencil icon > ADD ANOTHER ROLE and add the roles to your user account.

External references

  • For Compute Engine default service account information, see Service Accounts.
  • For Google Container Registry information, see Container Registry.
  • For GCP user account role information, see Understanding roles.
